item.title: An Economy of Meaning, or Bust
item.description: Current economic systems are dismal because they waste our precious time. We can pause to reevaluate, and redesign.

item.title: Wellbeing Centrality: Toward an Economics and Politics of Meaning
item.description: The designs of current economic and governance systems may be inadequate to solve our many pressing problems. Ideas from complexity science and other fields can help us re-conceptualize systems, leading to better designs.

item.title: Why Stop at Basic Income and a Living Wage?
item.description: We can ask the big question: Out of all conceivable economic system designs, which ones might be best at helping us to focus on and solve problems that matter?
